crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description:
If the CRNRSTN Suite :: has difficulty detecting the running environment from the server profiles that have been defined in the _crnrstn.config.inc.php configuration file, it will fire a notification with that information. This is just one example of many cases which involve the firing of event notifications through the CRNRSTN Suite :: notification class object. Through initLogging(), one is able to configure the event notification profile for each environment so that notifications can be handled in an orderly fashion.
Out of the box, CRNRSTN Suite :: comes configured with four (4) notification modes. Of the available modes, choose between:
DEFAULT: Send notice through environments' standard/default error notification handler (in PHP, calling the native error_log() method),
SCREEN: Output notice directly to screen through PHP native print(),
FILE: Append notice to custom file (/path/filename should be provided in initlogging () $endPointDetails parameter),
and EMAIL: Send notice to comma delimited list of email addresses (email(s) provided in initlogging () $endPointDetails parameter).

crnrstn_techspecscontent.crnrstn_techspec: It is recommended that you upgrade to the latest version of PHP to take advantage of the latest gains in security and processing efficiency.
Currently tested on an Ubuntu Server 16.04 running PHP 7.0.22 and Redhat Linux running PHP 5.5.38.

crnrstn_parameter.crnrstn_paramdefinition: A user-defined custom string identifying a specific hosting environment or server profile. E.g. "LOCALHOST_MY_OLD_MAC_TOWER", "LOCALHOST_PC" or "PROD_01".

Choose between DEFAULT, SCREEN, FILE and EMAIL to specify logging behavior. Also note that $oCRNRSTN->initLogging('LOCALHOST_MAC') will initialize logging to the DEFAULT system logs for the LOCALHOST_MAC environment.

If selected "FILE" in $loggingMode, then $endPointDetails should store the path+filename for the custom file. If EMAIL is specified in $loggingMode, then $endPointDetails should hold a comma delimited list of emails to which the logging notices should be sent.
